sen.j: 石斧（せきふ・いしおの）は石器の一種で、木の柄に取り付けた石製の斧。
sen.e: Stone axes were a kind of stone tools that were axes made of stone attached to wooden handle.
Stone axes were a kind of stone tools that were axes made of stone attached to wooden handle.
Stone axes were a kind of stone tools that were axes made of stone attached to wooden handle.

sen.j: 旧石器時代・縄文時代・弥生時代時代において主に樹木の伐採や土掘り、農耕用として使われた。
sen.e: Stone axes were mainly used for felling of trees, soil digging and farming in the Paleolithic period, Jomon period and Yayoi period.
Stone axes were mainly used for felling of trees, soil digging and farming in the Paleolithic period, the Jomon period and the Yayoi period.
Stone axes were mainly used for felling of trees, soil digging and farming in the Paleolithic period, the Jomon period and the Yayoi period.

tit.j: 製作方法とその変遷（日本における例）
tit.e: Manufacturing Method and Its Change (Examples in Japan)
Manufacturing Method and Its Change (Examples in Japan)
Manufacturing Method and Its Change (Examples in Japan)

sen.j: 旧石器時代
sen.e: Paleolithic Period
Paleolithic Period
Paleolithic Period

sen.j: 後期旧石器時代では打製石斧もしくは局部磨製石斧がつくられた。
sen.e: In late Paleolithic period chipped stone axes or partly ground stone axes were manufactured.
In late Paleolithic period chipped stone axes or partly ground stone axes were manufactured.
In late Paleolithic period chipped stone axes or partly ground stone axes were manufactured.

sen.j: 先土器文化における石斧は「斧形石器」「楕円形石器」と呼ばれているが、扁平な円礫あるいは大きな礫を打ち割った剥片の周辺を打撃して形を整えたものである。
sen.e: In pre-earthware culture stone axes were called ax-shaped stone tool or elliptic stone tool, and these were made by striking the nearby spots of flat pebble or broken pieces that big gravel shattered into.

In pre-earthenware culture stone axes were called 'ax-shaped stone tool' or 'elliptic stone tool,' and these were made by striking the nearby spots of flat pebble or broken pieces that big gravel shattered into.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションを補足しました。
sen.e: In pre-earthenware culture stone axes were called 'ax-shaped stone tool' or 'elliptic stone tool,' and these were made by striking the nearby spots of flat pebble or broken pieces that big gravel shattered into.

sen.j: 局部磨製石斧とは、刃の部分だけを磨いて実用に供したものである。
sen.e: Partly ground stone axes refer to the axes of which edge part was ground to be utilized.
Partly ground stone axes refer to the axes of which edge part was ground to be utilized.
Partly ground stone axes refer to the axes of which edge part was ground to be utilized.

sen.j: 片刃がやや多いが両刃も少なくない。
sen.e: Although single-edged axes were slightly more found, double-edged ones were not a few.
Although single-edged axes were slightly more found, double-edged ones were not a few.
Although single-edged axes were slightly more found, double-edged ones were not a few.

sen.j: 先土器時代の末期から縄文時代の草創期にかけては断面三角形またはカマボコ形を呈する片刃の御子柴型石斧が盛行する。
sen.e: From the end of pre-earthware period to the beginning of Jomon period single-edged mikoshiba-style stone axes that assumed the sectional triangular or semicylindrical shapes became popular.
From the end of pre-earthenware period to the beginning of the Jomon period, single-edged mikoshiba-style stone axes that assumed the sectional triangular or semi cylindrical shapes became popular.
From the end of pre-earthenware period to the beginning of the Jomon period, single-edged mikoshiba-style stone axes that assumed the sectional triangular or semi cylindrical shapes became popular.

sen.j: これはロシア沿海州やシベリア地方との関連の深い遺物と考えられている。
sen.e: These are believed to be the relics deeply connected with Russian maritime provinces and Siberian region.
These are believed to be the relics deeply connected with Russian maritime provinces and Siberian region.
These are believed to be the relics deeply connected with Russian maritime provinces and Siberian region.

sen.j: 縄文時代
sen.e: Jomon Period
Jomon Period
Jomon Period

sen.j: 縄文時代に入ってこれらに加え磨製石斧が作られた。
sen.e: When the Jomon period started, ground stone axes were manufactured in addition to the above-mentioned stone axes.
When the Jomon period started, ground stone axes were manufactured in addition to the previously mentioned stone axes.
When the Jomon period started, ground stone axes were manufactured in addition to the previously mentioned stone axes.

sen.j: 旧石器時代からの刃部のみの研磨された局部磨製石斧はだんだん姿を消していく。
sen.e: Partly ground stone axes of which edge part was ground in the Paleolithic period gradually disappeared.
Partly ground stone axes of which edge part was ground in the Paleolithic period gradually disappeared.
Partly ground stone axes of which edge part was ground in the Paleolithic period gradually disappeared.

sen.j: 全面研磨されたものは草創期に出現する。
sen.e: Stone axes of which all the sides were ground appeared in the beginning of Jomon period.
Stone axes of which all the sides were ground appeared in the beginning of the Jomon period.
Stone axes of which all the sides were ground appeared in the beginning of the Jomon period.

sen.j: 縄文時代早期から前期にかけての北日本では、砥石状工具を用いた擦切技法（すりきりぎほう）が発展する。
sen.e: A technique for cutting by rubbing based on grindstone shaped tool was developed in the earlier-early parts of the Jomon period in Northern Japan.
A technique for cutting by rubbing based on grindstone shaped tool was developed from the beginning to the early Jomon period in Northern Japan.
A technique for cutting by rubbing based on grindstone shaped tool was developed from the beginning to the early Jomon period in Northern Japan.

sen.j: しかし、この技法は縄文時代中期末にほぼ消滅する。
sen.e: However, this method almost disappeared in the end of middle Jomon period.
However, this method almost disappeared in the end of the middle Jomon period.
However, this method almost disappeared in the end of the middle Jomon period.

sen.j: 擦切技法の石斧とともに定角式磨製石斧も現れるが、この石斧が定型的な形を持ち、広い分布と出土量の多さを示してくるのは縄文中期末頃である。
sen.e: Although regularly curved stone axes also appeared with the stone axes based on the technique for cutting by rubbing, it is in the end of middle Jomon period that these stone axes had regular shape with wide diffusion and a large amount of excavation.

Although regularly curved stone axes also appeared with the stone axes based on the technique for cutting by rubbing, it is in the end of the middle Jomon period that these stone axes had regular shape with wide diffusion and a large amount of excavation.

Although regularly curved stone axes also appeared with the stone axes based on the technique for cutting by rubbing, it is in the end of the middle Jomon period that these stone axes had regular shape with wide diffusion and a large amount of excavation.

sen.j: 縄文後期になると、長さ2～2.5cmの磨製石斧のミニチュアがみられるようになる。
sen.e: In late Jomon period miniature ground stone axes with the length of 2 to 2.5 cm appeared.
In the late Jomon period miniature ground stone axes with the length of 2 to 2.5 centimeters appeared.
In the late Jomon period miniature ground stone axes with the length of 2 to 2.5 centimeters appeared.

sen.j: 小さいながらきわめて精巧にできているものが多く、研磨も行き届いて美麗なものが増える。
sen.e: Many of them were small but very elaborate; Well-polished and beautiful ones increased.
Many of them were small but very elaborate, and well-polished and beautiful ones increased.
Many of them were small but very elaborate, and well-polished and beautiful ones increased.

sen.j: なかには穴を空けたものもあり、とても実用品とは思われない。
sen.e: Some of them had holes, and these were not much practical.
Some of them had holes, and these were not considered as practical at all.
Some of them had holes, and these were not considered as practical at all.

sen.j: 縄文後期・晩期になると呪術的な遺物が著しく発達することからも、磨製石斧も儀器や装飾品としての意味合いを濃くしたものと考えられる。
sen.e: Because in the end of Jomon period occult relics developed remarkably, it was believed that ground stone axes increased the meaning as ceremonial vessels and accessories.
Because in the end of the Jomon period occult relics developed remarkably, it was believed that ground stone axes increased the meaning as ceremonial vessels and accessories.
Because in the end of the Jomon period occult relics developed remarkably, it was believed that ground stone axes increased the meaning as ceremonial vessels and accessories.

sen.j: いっぽう打製石斧は、縄文時代早期末に、三味線の撥（バチ）に似た形状で、鋭い剥離面を刃部とした片刃の石斧が北日本にみられ、それは「直刃斧」あるいは「トランシェ様石器」といわれ、後世の「手斧」のような使用が考えられる。
sen.e: On the other hand, as for chipped stone axes single-edged stone axes of which sharp broken side was blade area, in the form of samisen stick, were found in Northern Japan in the end of earlier Jomon period, and these are called "direct blade ax" or "tranche-style stone tool", and these are believed to be used as hand ax in the following times.

On the other hand, as for chipped stone axes single-edged stone axes of which sharp broken side was blade area, in the form of shamisen (a three-stringed Japanese banjo) stick, were found in the Northern Japan in the end of the early Jomon period, and these are called 'direct blade ax' or 'tranche-style stone tool,' and these are believed to be used as 'hand ax' in the following times.

On the other hand, as for chipped stone axes single-edged stone axes of which sharp broken side was blade area, in the form of shamisen (a three-stringed Japanese banjo) stick, were found in the Northern Japan in the end of the early Jomon period, and these are called 'direct blade ax' or 'tranche-style stone tool,' and these are believed to be used as 'hand ax' in the following times.

sen.j: 縄文中期中葉以降、関東地方や中部地方では打製石斧の数量が爆発的に増加するが、形状は短冊形、撥形、分銅形のものが多く、これらは垂直に打ち下ろす「斧」には向いていない。
sen.e: After the middle of middle Jomon period the number of chipped stone axes increased explosively in the Kanto and Chubu regions; many of these assumed the reed, plectrum or counterweight shapes, and not suitable for axes that were vertically brought down.

After the middle of the middle Jomon period the number of chipped stone axes increased explosively in the Kanto and Chubu regions; many of these assumed the reed, plectrum or counterweight shapes, and not suitable for 'axes' that were vertically brought down.

After the middle of the middle Jomon period the number of chipped stone axes increased explosively in the Kanto and Chubu regions; many of these assumed the reed, plectrum or counterweight shapes, and not suitable for 'axes' that were vertically brought down.

sen.j: 乳棒状磨製石斧や定角式磨製石斧など伐採具に適した道具が他にあることからも土掘りの道具と考えられている。
sen.e: These chipped stone axes were believed to be digging tools because there were other tools more suitable for felling such as mortar shaped ground stone ax or regularly curved ground stone ax.
These chipped stone axes were believed to be digging tools because there were other tools more suitable for felling such as mortar shaped ground stone ax or regularly curved ground stone ax.
These chipped stone axes were believed to be digging tools because there were other tools more suitable for felling such as mortar shaped ground stone ax or regularly curved ground stone ax.

sen.j: 旧石器時代の局部磨製石斧は、大型獣の狩猟や解体、木の伐採や切断、土掘りなど多目的に用いたもので、局部を磨いたのは土や木から斧を抜き取る際、いくらかでもスムーズに抜けるよう工夫したものであろう。
sen.e: Partly ground stone axes in the Paleolithic period were used for a wide range of applications such as hunting and disorganizing large-size animals, felling and cutting of trees, and soil digging; that these were partly ground was because when ax was pulled out of the soil and trees, these were able to be pulled out more smoothly.

Partly ground stone axes in the Paleolithic period were used for a wide range of applications such as hunting and disorganizing large-size animals, felling and cutting of trees, and soil digging; that these were partly ground was because when ax was pulled out of the soil and trees, these were able to be pulled out more smoothly.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Partly ground stone axes in the Paleolithic period were used for a wide range of applications such as hunting and disorganizing large-size animals, felling and cutting of trees, and soil digging; that these were partly ground was because when ax was pulled out of the soil and trees, these were able to be pulled out more smoothly.

sen.j: 縄文時代に入って定住生活が一般化すると、用途に応じた打製石斧・磨製石斧、大小や形状さまざまの石斧がつくられるようになった。
sen.e: When permanent residence became common with the entry of Jomon period, chipped stone axes and ground stone axes for various purposes, and stone axes that were various in size and shape were manufactured.
When permanent residence became common in the Jomon period, chipped stone axes, ground stone axes, and stone axes that were various in size and shape were manufactured for various purposes.
When permanent residence became common in the Jomon period, chipped stone axes, ground stone axes, and stone axes that were various in size and shape were manufactured for various purposes.

sen.j: 打製石斧は、中期以降土掘り具としての利用が主流をなすとみられる。
sen.e: It is believed that chipped stone axes were mainly used for digging after the middle of Jomon period.
It is believed that chipped stone axes were mainly used for digging after the middle of the Jomon period.
It is believed that chipped stone axes were mainly used for digging after the middle of the Jomon period.

sen.j: このことからかつて「縄文農耕」が唱えられたこともあったが、少なくとも根茎類採集が生活において重要な位置を占めるに至ったことを示すものであることは確かとみられる。
sen.e: Although once some people speaked on farming in the Jomon period on the basis of this, we can at least safely say from this that gathering root and stalk held the important position in lives of people in the Jomon period.

Although once some people spoke on 'farming in the Jomon period' on the basis of this, we can at least safely say from this that gathering root and stalk held the important position in lives of people in the Jomon period.

Although once some people spoke on 'farming in the Jomon period' on the basis of this, we can at least safely say from this that gathering root and stalk held the important position in lives of people in the Jomon period.

sen.j: いっぽう、磨きの技術も徐々に発展し、精緻な磨製石斧も現れる。
sen.e: Meanwhile techniques for grinding were developed gradually, and elaborate ground stone axes appeared.
Meanwhile techniques for grinding were developed gradually, and elaborate ground stone axes appeared.
Meanwhile techniques for grinding were developed gradually, and elaborate ground stone axes appeared.

sen.j: 伐採や木材加工用の実用品のほか、祭祀につかわれたものも増える。
sen.e: In addition to the practical goods for felling and wood processing, the ones used for religious service increased.
In addition to the practical goods for felling and wood processing, the ones used for religious service increased.
In addition to the practical goods for felling and wood processing, the ones used for religious service increased.

sen.j: 秋田県東成瀬村の上掵遺跡からは、長さ60.2cm、重さ4.4kgの世界最大級の磨製石斧（緑色凝灰岩製）が出土している。
sen.e: The world's largest ground stone ax (made of green tuff) with the length of 60.2 cm and weight of 4.4 kg was unearthed from the Uwahaba remains of Higashinaruse-cho, Akita Prefecture.

The world's largest ground stone ax (made of green tuff) with the length of 60.2 centimeters and weight of 4.4 kilograms was unearthed from the Uwahaba-iseki Remains of Higashinaruse Village, Akita Prefecture.

The world's largest ground stone ax (made of green tuff) with the length of 60.2 centimeters and weight of 4.4 kilograms was unearthed from the Uwahaba-iseki Remains of Higashinaruse Village, Akita Prefecture.

sen.j: 縄文時代前期の遺物とみられるが、使用痕跡もなく、祭祀のための遺物と考えられる。
sen.e: Although it is regarded as a relic in the early part of Jomon period, it showed no sign of having been used, so it is seen as a relic for religious service.
Although it is regarded as a relic in the early Jomon period, it showed no sign of having been used, so it is seen as a relic for religious service.
Although it is regarded as a relic in the early Jomon period, it showed no sign of having been used, so it is seen as a relic for religious service.

sen.j: 北海道伊達市 (北海道)の北黄金貝塚からは、軽石製の磨製石斧が出土している。
sen.e: Ground stone ax made of pumice was unearthed from the Kitakogane shell mounds of Date City, Hokkaido.
Ground stone ax made of pumice was unearthed from the Kitakogane-kaizuka Shell Mounds of Date City, Hokkaido Prefecture.
Ground stone ax made of pumice was unearthed from the Kitakogane-kaizuka Shell Mounds of Date City, Hokkaido Prefecture.

sen.j: これも実用されたのではない。
sen.e: This was also not for practical use.
This was also not for practical use.
This was also not for practical use.

sen.j: 縄文時代後期の作と考えられる。
sen.e: This was thought to be manufactured in late Jomon period.
This was thought to be manufactured in the late Jomon period.
This was thought to be manufactured in the late Jomon period.

sen.j: 備考
sen.e: Notes
Notes
Notes

sen.j: 「ギャートルズ」など一部の漫画で、木の柄に紐で石斧をくくり付けた道具が、動物の捕殺や闘争などに使われる場面が描かれているが、柄に紐で固定しただけでは強度・耐久性が不充分で使用に耐えない。
sen.e: Some cartoons such as "GON, THE STONE-AGE BOY" depicts the scene such as characters uses the tools in which stone ax is fastened to wood handle with string, for capture and killing of animals or fighting; however, only fastening to wooden handle with string is insufficient in strength and durability and unavailable.

Some cartoons such as 'GON, THE STONE-AGE BOY' depicts the scene such as characters uses the tools in which stone ax is fastened to wood handle with string, for capture and killing of animals or fighting; however, only fastening to wooden handle with string is insufficient in strength and durability and unavailable.

Some cartoons such as 'GON, THE STONE-AGE BOY' depicts the scene such as characters uses the tools in which stone ax is fastened to wood handle with string, for capture and killing of animals or fighting; however, only fastening to wooden handle with string is insufficient in strength and durability and unavailable.

sen.j: このような道具が実際に用いられた事はない。
sen.e: These tools have never been used.
These tools have never been actually used.
These tools have never been actually used.

sen.j: 旧石器時代前期から中期にかけて、握斧（あくふ hand axe）と呼ばれる石器がヨーロッパなどで多数見つかっている。
sen.e: In the early-middle parts of Paleolithic period, stone tools called hand axes were found in great numbers in Europe.
From the early to the middle of the Paleolithic period, stone tools called Akufu (hand axes) were found in great numbers in Europe.
From the early to the middle of the Paleolithic period, stone tools called Akufu (hand axes) were found in great numbers in Europe.

sen.j: 形は石斧によく似ているが、文字通り手に握って、土を掘ったり動物を解体したり木を削ったり、その他多様な用途に用いられたと考えられる。
sen.e: Hand axes resembled stone axes in shape, and hand axes were used for a variety of applications: literally gripping these to dig the soil, disorganize animals and shave wood.
Akufu resembled stone axes in shape, and Akufu were used for a variety of applications: Literally gripping these to dig the soil, disorganize animals and shave wood.
Akufu resembled stone axes in shape, and Akufu were used for a variety of applications: Literally gripping these to dig the soil, disorganize animals and shave wood.

sen.j: 木の柄にはめ込んだ本来の石斧が現われるのは後期旧石器時代に入ってからである。
sen.e: The original stone axes fit into wood handle appeared after the latter part of Paleolithic period.
The original stone axes fit into wood handle appeared after the late Paleolithic period.
The original stone axes fit into wood handle appeared after the late Paleolithic period.
